description.narrative: Umbrella Programme to Support the Saudi Tourism and Antiquities Commission

This Umbrella Programme intends to support the Saudi Commission for Tourism and Antiquities (SCTA) to discharge its national mandate of boosting the contribution of the tourism and antiquities sector to the economy.

name.narrative: Riyadh

description.narrative: capital of a political entity
Accountability - local government finance
Time-share and tour guide regulations adopted.

comment.narrative: -Tourism has been selected as a potential growth sector to increase job opportunities for the poor, particularly in rural areas. -Designs of two major tourist development areas prepared; major components of relevant laws formulated and validated
Human resources developed in promotion of key tourist professions.
Regulations formulated to govern all aspects of tourism performance (time-share, tour guide and accommodation).

description.narrative: CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF WATER RESOURCES IN THE KINGDOM OF SAUDI ARABIA

title.narrative: Capacity Development for Sustainable Development and Management of Water
Capacity Development for Sustainable Development and Management of Water

description.narrative: Providing Capacity Development to Ministry of Water and Electricity staff in terms of IWRM, for sustainable development

name.narrative: Wizarat al Miyah wa al Kahraba’

description.narrative: administrative facility

name.narrative: Wizarat al Miyah wa al Kahraba’

description.narrative: administrative facility
Accountability - local government finance

comment.narrative: A number of detailed studies of ground water resources assessment completed

estimate agriculture water demand of Kingdom through Remote Sensing & GIS techniques. Estimate water withdrawals for potable water supply and withdrawals for industries and agriculture. Prepare National IWRM Plan to integrate strategies and programs for surface, groundwater, desalinated and wastewater reuse, and formulate measures to efficient use of water resources.

The Project carried out the study on the impact of flood water injection in the aquifer, and its impact on areas lakes behind and front of the dams. The ministry is supplying the agricultural sector with treated water in different regions, and is currently being expanded. A workshop was carried over to activate the full use of wastewater, and are currently planning according to what has been discussed. The Ministry engaged with the Ministry of Agriculture to determine the scope of sustainable use of water resources in the Kingdom.

description.narrative: MOT is aiming at developing sustainable transport systems and improving road safety. The project addresses two activity fields: (i) Strengthening governance through NTS reporting and review, and (ii) Capacity building for road and transport safety.
Technical assistance to the Ministry of Transport to support the implementation of the National Transport Strategy and Intelligent Transport System.

name.narrative: Wizarat an Naql

description.narrative: administrative facility
Quality of transport policies and level of inter-agency coordination -Level of public transport services and use of Intelligent Transport Systems -Level of road safety and eco-friendly transport

comment.narrative: -Lack of national transport strategy to guide sector activities as focus for inter-agency coordination -No public transport in cities, and ITS capacities not developed -High levels of road death rates and high levels of vehicle pollution levels
ITS design reviewed by MOT for implementation and staff trained

- Final report on ITS design for Dammam Highway Traffic Management System submitted after comments by MOT. - Organized and carried out a training session for MOT on road hydrology and analysis for road design. - Report on gap analysis and need assessment for safe road design delivered to MOT.

description.narrative: This is the first phase (2011-2013) in the framework of a six-year (2011-2017) capacity building programme for the Ministry of Economy and Planning, aimed at supporting the recently published Ninth National Development Plan (NDP; 2010-14).
Supporting strategic planning in Saudi Arabia

Planning tools (GIS) enhanced and operational 4. Qualify of life indicators produced at the regional level 5. Green economy case study produced for one province

comment.narrative: Balanced regional development is the major objective of the five-year planning process
National policies formulated for balanced regional development and equitable distribution of development results

The national priorities produced in the framework of the Tenth Development Plan (2015-2019) with focus on sustainability policies in terms of diversification of the economic base away from entire reliance on oil and gas revenues.

description.narrative: The second phase of a capacity development programme for the new Saudi Energy Efficiency Centre to develop Energy Efficiency Policy and Regulations
Technical assistance to King Abdul-Aziz City for Science and Technology in terms of Energy Efficiency .

name.narrative: Riyadh

description.narrative: capital of a political entity
Energy - power generation
National Strategy Submitted to SEEC Board

comment.narrative: The Center is established and the Energy Efficiency Laws is drafted
To develop specific policies and regulations targeting industry, buildings and transport sector and to introduce labelling standards.

Several Workshops to discuss the updated energy efficiency standards with a number of government entities and International consultants and agencies; ASHARE, Saudi Custom, World Bank, Shell, International Council of Clean Transportation (ICCT) Middle East Lighting Association ( MELA( and others. In addition a database for industries, light duty vehicles fuel economy label, tires and used cars was prepared. Also an awareness campaigns through media and other mean were launched to introduce the new standards for the public. The National Energy Efficiency strategic plan should be completed at the end of 2016. Furthermore, the enforcement of the new standards for white good has started in March 2015 for Washing machines and in May 2015 for the refrigerators and freezers. This enforcement is expected to reduce the electricity consumption by up to 40%. In addition w workshop was conducted with lighting manufactures and importer to introduce the lighting standards for residential sector (SASO 2870/2015). The aerodynamic regulation for heavy duty vehicles in transportation sector has been drafted.
National Energy Efficiency Strategic Plan completed, and number of engineers and technicians are certified from accredited energy institutions and qualify national trainers in EE field.

description.narrative: This project has been designed to develop national capacities in delivering the objectives and priorities of the Saudi National Urban Spatial Strategy (NSS) as part of the mandate of the Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs (MOMRA).
